Headline: Wee and Singapore counterpart seek way forward in crossing borders | The Star
Text:
Saturday, 12 Jun 2021
                PETALING JAYA: Transport Minister Datuk Seri Dr Wee Ka Siong (pic) and his Singaporean counterpart S. Iswaran held their first virtual video call to discuss various issues pertaining to their portfolios.“During our half-hour discussion, we spoke about several issues covering all transportation sectors that will bring mutual benefit to citizens of Malaysia and Singapore, ” he said in a Facebook post yesterday.Some of the thousands of Malaysians who used to commute daily to Singapore for work have been left stranded when the border closed.Singapore also suspended its Reciprocal Green Lane cross-border travel scheme with Malaysia following a spike in Covid-19 cases across the Causeway at the start of the year.Dr Wee said that the two leaders shared the efforts taken by both countries to fight the Covid-19 pandemic, including the vaccination programme as well as efforts to revive and stimulate the economy.“We will also continue such discussions using various available channels although borders have been closed now due to the Covid-19 pandemic, ” said Dr Wee.“Certainly, the diplomatic relations between Malaysia and Singapore will continue to be strengthened for our mutual growth and prosperity, ” he said.
